page.title: 01Area around Loch Craignish.
page.content: The A816(T) road from Lochgilphead (15 miles) to Oban (25 miles) cuts through the N.E. corner of the block and descends sharply (1:8) from the Bealach Mor(big pass) & over Barbreck River which marks the border between the 2 parishes.Further on (but beyond block)the B8002 leaves the A816 & runs beside the loch (almost the length of Craignish peninsular & passing Castle) going through Ardfern (N.W of block). On the Kilmartin side there are no roads (except A816 section)other than Forestry Commission and farm tracks.(4 farmers lands adjoin and are used as grazing (sheep mostly and cattle.) The land is mountainous and rocky. The slopes facing the loch have been plant ed with sitka spruce. There is a house here (Ormaig)& 1 on island(Eilean Mhic Crion) both used for holidays only. Maps show duns,cairns,standing stones.
